channel.title: Georgia golfers at the British Open
channel.description: More than a dozen golfers with ties to Georgia and Georgia Tech will be on the links at the Open Championship on the coastal town of Hoylake in Northwest England.

item.title: Brian Harman
item.description: On Sunday Brian Harman became the sixth former Georgia Bulldog golfer to win on the PGA Tour this year at the John Deere Classic. Harman joins a dozen players with ties to Georgia who will be on the links at the Open Championship on the coastal town of Hoylake in Northwest England.
item.dc:creator: Gregory Shamus

item.title: Bubba Watson
item.description: Bubba Watson has two PGA Tour wins this season. He won the Northern Trust Open in February at Pacific Palisades, Calif., and captured his second Masters Tournament at Augusta National in April.
item.dc:creator: Harry How

item.title: Harris English
item.description: Harris English won the OHL Classic at Mayakoba in November his second PGA TOUR title.
item.dc:creator: Darren Carroll

item.title: Russell Henley
item.description: Russell Henley's playoff win at the Honda Classic over Rory McIlroy and Ryan Palmer in March catupulted him into a Top 50 world ranking and a spot in the Masters.
item.dc:creator: Stuart Franklin

item.title: Chris Kirk
item.description: In the final round of the The McGladrey Classic at Sea Island Golf Club in November, Atlanta's Chris Kirk shot a 4-under 66 to win his second PGA TOUR event.
item.dc:creator: Sam Greenwood

item.title: Brendon Todd
item.description: In May, Brendon Todd won his first PGA Tour event, in his 77th start at the HP Byron Nelson Championship. Todd shot a bogey free round of 66 on the final day to finish two strokes ahead of Mike Weir. The victory earned Todd a two year tour exemption and ensured a first visit to The Masters in 2015.
item.dc:creator: Tom Pennington

item.title: Erik Compton
item.description: Erik Compton, a two-time heart transplant recipient recently tied for second at the U.S. Open.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Redington

item.title: Cameron Tringale
item.description: A fourth-place finish at the PGA Tour's Greenbrier Classic earned Georgia Tech golfer Cameron Tringale a spot in the Open.
item.dc:creator: Todd Warshaw

item.title: Chesson Hadley
item.description: Former Tech golfer Chesson Hadley has three top-10 finishes and six top-25s in 23 overall PGA starts.
item.dc:creator: Jared Wickerham

item.title: Roberto Castro
item.description: Fomer Tech golfer Roberto Castro will be making his British Open debut.
item.dc:creator: Jon Durr

item.title: Matt Kuchar
item.description: Matt Kuchar, the 5th-ranked golfer in the world and former Tech star, won the RBC Heritage in April.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Lecka

item.title: David Duval
item.description: David Duval (Tech '93) won the British Open in 2001.
item.dc:creator: Stacy Revere

item.title: Stewart Cink
item.description: Stewart Cink's (Tech '95) lone major win came at the 2009 Open.
item.dc:creator: Richard Heathcote
